text:
Grant Masaru Imahara (October 23, 1970 – July 13, 2020) was an American electrical engineer, roboticist, and television host. He was best known for his work on the television series "MythBusters". He starred in the Netflix series "White Rabbit Project". Imahara was born in Los Angeles, California.
Imahara died from a sudden intracranial aneurysm in Los Angeles on July 13, 2020 at age of 49.
